author: Kristen Corbisiero
text: 'We go here all the time and absolutely love the quality of the dishes!'

author: Valerie Alvarez
text: "My friend and I's go to dinner spot on a Friday or Saturday night.  We absolutely love Apulia
column5: the food is fresh and delicious.  The pizza is amazing and we love that there are so many GF options for my friend who has celiac.  It is also BYOB which is an added bonus.  Definitely try Apulia
column6: it will quickly become one of your favorites!"

author: Ann Soares
text: 'Outstanding. Everything was delicious!'

author: Pubg mobile SLAYER
text: 'Great food. Pizza is amazing. Pastas are authentic and flavorful. Great vibe. Chill music. Gelato is delicious as well!!!'

author: Annie O'Brien
text: 'Best pizza in Hoboken hands down!! Authentic and quality Italian cuisine. Loved every dish I had there‚Ä¶ Pizza Diavola and Cacio e Pepe are ü§åüèº. Ambience in the backyard is also awesome when weather permits!'

author: erin pawlik
text: 'Went here for a birthday party last weekend. The food was absolutely spectacular. Highly suggest the burrata and fritto misto to start. Diavola and D.O.P. Pizzas were to die for! Great atmosphere and fun music. Highly recommend!'

author: Lindsay Rechan
text: 'Delicious pizza. Great atmosphere. A must do in Hoboken'

author: Joanna Sciacca
text: 'Best food
column5: best ambiance
column6: best staff.'

author: James Caponata
text: "Truly Italian
column5: from food to attitude!!!. Love these guys
column6: they do it their way. Food is clean
column7: fresh and well crafted. Price points are fair considering location.\n\nHave an open mind and be respectful and you'll understand this place!"

author: Isabelle Soares
text: 'Amazing food and ambience. Cant wait to go back 10/10'

author: Vincent Vogt
text: 'Great food. Unfortunately the loud music made it impossible to have a conversation giving the whole experience a rather immature vibe.'

author: Isabelle Soares
text: 'Best pizza I‚Äôve ever had
column5: great service
column6: beautiful patioüòç'

author: Rose Phelan
text: 'We absolutely love this place. True italian cuisine
column5: everything on the menu is worth trying! ü§©'

author: Kiley Dumas
text: 'We‚Äôve been to this restaurant 20+ times and it is consistently phenomenal. Highly recommend the prosciutto and mozzarella
column5: inferno pizza
column6: spaghetti amatriana
column7: and cacio Pepe pasta. Best  pizza I‚Äôve ever had!'

author: Griffin Sorenson
text: 'Frank
column5: Franco and Ryan are amazing. This is my favorite spot to eat in Hoboken. My fianc√© and I go here regularly and love the pizza
column6: pasta and gelato. I love the inferno pizza. Also must try the mozzarella and prosciutto. These guys get great food and great atmosphere. Don‚Äôt often do reviews but this place for sure want everyone to know what a hidden gem we have. It‚Äôs BYO but they also have wine available
column7: I usually bring my own beer.'

author: Sal Benanti
text: 'Joans outta her mind
column5: this place slaps. Best pizza in Hoboken!'

author: Jacquie F
text: 'One of a kind
column5: unique atmosphere and delicious food. Our family order basically one of everything off the menu and enjoyed every bite of it!! Definitely coming back for more üòä'

author: Francesco F.
text: "One of the best place I've eaten in the US after 2 yrs in the US.  The pizza is fantastic.  I felt as home!"

author: Marco Vitrano
text:
'(Translated by Google) Great food and great service!
I had amatriciana al dente and super tasty.
Buffalo mozzarella and Parma ham was great. Good quality! Enjoy your meal!

(Original)
Great food and great service!
I had amatriciana al dente and super tasty.
Mozzarella di bufala and prosciutto di Parma was great. Buona qualit√†! Buon appetito!'

author: RJ Lombardi
text: 'One of the best pizzas in Hoboken.'

author: Lindsay Ward
text: "Bruschetta was delicious. Pizza was incredible. Everything about this place was fabulous. I just didn't care for the one white pasta because it had wayyyyy to much black pepper in it."

author: Andrea Siciliano
text: 'We ordered our dinner and it came out in ten minutes (which is great). Ate it quickly and was promptly asked if we wanted dessert. I said please give us a minute to look at the menu. Sixty seconds later
column5: the waiter comes back. I ordered gelato. Finished it and was given the check and told I had ten minutes. We were probably there for a total of 30 minutes and had a half bottle of wine (byob + corking fee).  I inquired w the waiter why we had to leave and he said there‚Äôs a time limit of 90 minutes (we were about an HOUR below that).  He said if you ordered more food you can stay the 90 (which is insane
column6: we more wine to go through). Also
column7: I probably would have ordered more wine. I thought oh they must have a long line (meanwhile it‚Äôs a random Wednesday night). Nope. No one waiting. The most rushed restaurant experience EVER. I felt more at ease with time limits during covid than I did tonight. Such bad service and etiquette.'

author: Brandon Pollock
text: 'Love this place
column5: the vibe
column6: the food
column7: the service. I personally think this is my favorite pizza in Hoboken.'

author: Vera Tarassova
text: 'Sent back a carbonara for being overly salty and was told that is how carbonara always is
column5: we told them we are not eating and were still charged for it. Plenty of other places to get some good food
column6: better yet skip jersey and go into the city for better food and service.'

author: Allison Ehrhart
text: 'great little BYOB spot in uptown hoboken. the pizza was really good and the interior terrace is a great vibe. service was also very good. would definitely go back!'

author: Mitali Bhiwande
text: 'A fine italian restaurant with great food and a good vibe! The inferno pizza is absolutely delicious!!  The theatrics with the presentation were unexpectedly delightful
column5: the pizza was literally on fire! We also ordered the ravioli and panzerotti which were equally good. The tiramisu is a must have!!!'

author: Jaclyn Huntington
text: 'Excellent Authentic Italian Food and Ambience!!! The Owner and Manager was extremely welcoming and personable! I highly recommend this restaurant for any occasion. The pizza was dynamite! üçïüçùüç∑'

author: Dillon Wu
text: 'Apulia is easily one of the best pizza places in Hoboken. Great service
column5: fresh food and good wine. Appetizers
column6: salads
column7: pizza
column9: main courses and even dessert! All excellent!'

author: Ant
text: 'Great pizza and great outdoor seating. Staff was super friendly as well!'

author: Matthew S
text: 'Great authentic Italian! This is a must try- I highly recommend anything on their menu!'

author: Jessica Nisler
text: 'Had a great experience last Friday.  Delicious pizza
column5: friendly staff.'

author: Ishaan Patel
text: 'The owner/manager is so rude. When we sent back the pasta to ask a question about it
column5: he stormed outside the kitchen and attacked us in front of other customers. He said this is the way the run things at this place and they don‚Äôt care what the customer says. Trust me
column6: you‚Äôll get better service elsewhere. The pizza was good but there‚Äôs a THOUSAND places that you could go to get great tasting pizza but this place isn‚Äôt worth it.'

author: Daniel Salcedo
text: "A friend of mine told us about this place. The minute you taste their pizza you transport yourself to Italy. It's probably the most authentic pizza I ever tried in America. It's so fresh and delicious and it's BYOB.  I am waiting for the NYT to rated this Pizza as good as Razza (which according to them is the best pizza in NY). I also love their local element and the whole story about Puglia a region in Italy which is where their name and their taste come from."

author: Kleri Marie
text: 'My brother and I go every week! The pizza is unbeatable and the pasta is always amazing. Make sure to try there specials when they have them
column5: I wish they could keep them all year round!'

author: Maria Fernanda Marmolejo
text: 'The pizza is delicious'

author: Lori T
text: 'Great spot- cozy
column5: friendly staff
column6: great food
column7: and BYOB. We need to support these guys during COVID. They need the help and it will be a shame if this spot goes. A great find in uptown Hoboken.'

author: Cara L.
text: "I was just reading the reviews before picking a restaurant to go to in Hoboken and
column5: honestly
column6: the food sounds great but reading the restaurant's responses to less than glowing reviews just put a bad taste in my mouth that no good food could fix.  I can't see spending my time or money in a place that is so dismissive of their customers.  Even if the customer is wrong being so hostile and disrespectful in all of these responses is really awful. There was a better way to respond.  Stay classy guys."

author: Melissa Schultz
text: 'We‚Äôve been dining at Apulia since they first opened their doors. Over the years they became one of our favorite restaurants in Hoboken. Their friendly service
column5: food quality and flexibility with dietary restrictions have gone above and beyond. We recently moved out of Hoboken into the suburbs. Last Sunday
column6: January 3rd
column7: we spent a night back in Hoboken. Out of all the restaurant choices
column8: we chose to dine here. This is no longer just a favorite in Hoboken
column9: but all of NJ! Thank you Frank
column10: Ryan and staff for a wonderful evening!'

author: Alan Morstein
text: 'Rip City.\nI know they are suffering
column5: but ripping off locals is weak.\nThe portions are mini and poorly displayed.\nSoon to be another restaurant causality if they keep this up.'

author: Erick Rodriguez
text: 'Best food
column5: delicious'

author: Randy Flores
text: 'pizza and the feeling here is excellent. Nothing but great experiences here. The place has a nice atmosphere.'

author: Duygu TIGLI
text: 'Down to earth cool people
column5: amazing thin crust pizza with high quality ingredients
column6: good atmosphere
column7: good vibes

author: Gaurav Shankar
text: '| Answers | Service: Dine in'

author: Andy T
text: 'Great pizza and service. Open during covid-19. Nice outdoor seating.'

author: JJ Jones
text: 'I recommend the Orecchiette E Rapini pasta and Inferno pizza if you like spicy food.'

author: Michael Berg
text: 'Fantastic! Try the truffle pasta!'

author: Neil Amaral
text: "My wife and I have been ordering from here for the last few months. The pizza is great
column5: the bucatini is great
column6: and we've also tried the ravioli which was also great. Thank God they were open for delivery during COVID19. I can't wait to eat there in person."

author: FKD Smile
text: 'We were a party of 5 and travelled from Ridgewood
column5: New Jersey.  Totally worth it!\nThese people....  This place...  Oh my dear JESUS...  I think I ate for six...  (Personally ate for 6)...  My goodness
column6: the food and the hospitality made me feel better than being at home.\nWe had a lanky red headed server. Ryan.  He was so invested and so empathetic...  We LITERALLY told him to bring whatever is good.  We started a big wooden tray of delish...  Prosciutto and cheese and grapes...  Yumzo...  Then with some octopus üêô personally I am not a fan
column7: but it was sooooooo good.  A couple green salads (again not a fan
column8: but the table gobbled them up...)\nBring on the üçï pizza...  We had 4 pies...  A goat cheese honey pie
column9: just order it like that...  They will know what ur talking about...  Jaw dropping delish...  Such a safari for ur taste buds...  U will believe me when u eat it...  A diablo sauced stunner and a marina "total simplicity offering"...\nThe pasta was sooooooo perfect. The texture and the al dente firmness...  Woe...  The gelato was spot on also...  We r food snobs so I must say
column10: it was simple utter perfection...  One of our lunch guests has travelled to over 80 countries and gave a 2 thumbs up...  (Even worth the parking ticket
column11: he told us).  There is simply one downside...  Parking is pretty AWFUL...  APULIA & it\'s people are a GOD SEND!  Thank you for enduring this covid-19 craziness and all the best to ur organization!'

author: Kevin Recio
text: 'Artisinal pizza with gelato. Nice outdoor back patio for social distance dining.'

author: Josh Anderson
text:
'Treat your customers with some respect next time.

The manager is absolutely disrespectful to his customers.

Customer was told to take a seat on the back patio and did so. The manager said ‚Äúsorry you must get up that table is reserved.‚Äù Customer said ‚Äúwell then tell me where to sit and I‚Äôll move.‚Äù The manager said ‚Äúwhy don‚Äôt you ask next time before taking a seat‚Äù

Picture: Patio is COMPLETELY empty!!!
Food: Amazing!'

author: Carla Reagan
text: 'Absolutely delish. fresh prosciutto
column5: shave parmigiana
column6: and arugula
column7: my favorite pizza ever.'

author: Virginia Patrone
text: 'In an area where amazing pizza is not too hard to come by
column5: this pizza ranks just above average for me. Really delicious dough with a satisfying bite
column6: but the ingredients and flavors fall a bit short in comparison to other pizza greats in the area. Not to mention being given the shakedown for an extra $3.00 at the end of my ($22 pizza) meal to meet the $25 per person minimum didn‚Äôt exactly leave a good taste in my mouth. For my money Panello and Porta are where it‚Äôs at for top notch pizza and service
column7: but this place isn‚Äôt a bad backup.'

author: Edward L
text: "Been here a few times. Don't expect that crispy thin NY style pizza here. It's more about the rustic feel but the sogginess turns me off despite seeing the guy make your pie 10' from you. Still good. Took parents to here."

author: Coco Mocco
text: 'Was surprised they have minimum 25$ charge PER PERSON right now during COVID and they try to sell you Tasting menu which is 28$ at least. I asked waiter if that‚Äôs for two people he said - yes. Ended up paying 60$ bill at the end! They don‚Äôt tell you they charge for each person per ONE tasting
column5: I found it very confusing and disappointing.\nNot coming back. Prob only will place delivery for pizza if they have it option
column6: cuz pizza is delicious there.'

author: Stephen Lagano
text: 'Open back outside area.  Food and service just as good as before Covid.  Welcome back and best of luck moving forward. Thanks'

author: Tamar Amitay
text: "My absolute favorite foodie fantastic restaurant in Hoboken! I  pretty much can't get by a week without my DOP pizza (think wood fired arugula pancetta mozzerella  yumminess). Frank and his team have it all - great ambience
column5: interesting curated food with an eye on the exceptional. I just had a Nutella Panzaretto Gelato off menu dessert that I can't stop thinking about! PS they deliver! Highly recommended- an wonderful gem"

author: Christina Sonageri
text: 'I have a long list of why I love this restaurant! The entire staff is amazing
column5: personable and attentive. The quality of the food is top-notch! You can tell everything is fresh and the chef really knows what he is doing. It is BYOB and incredibly reasonably priced; and the overall atmosphere is welcoming and cozy without feeling stuffy. This has definitely become one of my go-to spots!'

author: Lauren Huntington
text: 'I held a private event at Apulia earlier this month and wow! We loved going there for family dinners already but working with them for our event was awesome. They were so accommodating
column5: helpful
column6: responsive
column7: friendly... truly a dream to work with. Not to mention the food! My husband and I had amazing pizza in Tuscany and had not tasted anything even close until Apulia opened uptown. The guys that own and operate this gem are the best- do yourself a favor and go for dinner at least! Thank you Frank and the Apulia team for making our event a huge success!'

author: Pat D
text: 'Great food very clean and FRESH owners and staff really go beyond to make sure you have a good time.'

author: adrian victoria
text:
'(Translated by Google) Excellent fine tea and Italian cuisine

(Original)
Excelente bien te y cocina italiana'

author: Amanda
text: 'best pizza I‚Äôve ever had!! Great looking staff'

author: Vincent Ferrante
text: "Pizza was authentic
column5: the portions were small
column6: the service was awful and not accomodating. We were rushed to the extend of having guests hovering our tableside  to rush us out. We didn't think 75 minutes dinner fo a table of five  was long. Ran the server certainly needs more training."

author: Greg DiGiovine
text: 'Awesome Pizza - try wo cheese\nAwesome Service\nAwesome Menu'

author: Benicio Dennis
text: 'Had a excellent experience in this place with my daughter. The food was served fast and the service is just awesome. Prices are reasonable.'

author: Katharine Smith
text: 'nice service!'

author: Lisa Lowell
text: 'This food is fantastic...My husband and I loved every minute of it. Service
column5: atmosphere
column6: and ofcourse delicious healthy food....üëç'

author: Morris Goldberg
text: 'From the pizza maker to the waitress to the owner everyone is awesome the food is great and the Nutella desert is to die for'

author: Rudy Scott
text: "Expect great food and vibes from Apulia. From the cheese & bread I started with
column5: to the pizza and finishing up with some of the best gelato (try the pistachio) I've had in a while...it was all so good. The service was perfect and the passion from the guys behind the scenes is evident...professionally run for sure üòÅ"

author: Jameson Roberts
text: 'Byob
column5: had pizza and pasta
column6: it all tasted fresh
column7: not salty. Warm homely atmosphere'

author: yulia N.
text: 'Such a charming and stylishly decorated Italian restaurant specializing in Napoli style pizza! We had an amazing dinner here: burrata cheese
column5: octopus
column6: prosciutto pizza and no cheese pizza with marinara sauce
column7: capers and anchovies (What an amazing crust!! )\nIt‚Äôs BYOB but they do have a small selection of wines available at great prices!\nService was amazing as well: very friendly and fast. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!'

author: Richard Torres
text: 'I actually love the dishes and customer service
column5: good location very close to where I live. The workers are always nice. Highly recommended.'

author: Mike Falvo
text: 'Creative recipes and everything cooked perfectly!  Big eaters focus on the pizza'

author: John Pope
text: 'Outstanding food for foodies!'

author: Panos Ioannou
text: 'Chewy crispy crust\nPremium ingredients\nWood-fired awesomeness.'

author: Everardo Castro
text: 'Busy'

author: David Torres
text: 'Good pizza
column5: but there better places in Hoboken.'

author: Ned Taddei
text: "Wow.  I took my family of five to Apulia last night for my wife's birthday.  We had an absolutely tremendous experience!!!  Every part of the dinner from the service to the food to the BYOB was superb.  We started off with the Prosciutto de Parma which I highly recommend. I can still taste the fresh prosciutto!   For entrees we had three pizzas and two pasta dishes.  The pasta was al dente; the sauces on the pasta dishes were perfect and the ingredients on the pizzas just oozed fresh!   The pizza is simply to-die-for!  We topped it off with Apulia's homemade gelato desserts for which there are no words to describe.   People who in these reviews complained about the price point are simply cheap or don't know great food when they get it.  In the past
column5: we have had to travel to Edgewater or North Bergen to get really good brick/coal oven pizza.  Not any more.  This diamond in the rough is our new go-to spot!  Thank you Franco and Pasqua for a wonderful evening!"

author: Melanie Kaye
text: "We LOVE Apulia.  Their pizza's are amazing and they just use the best
column5: highest quality ingredients in everything.  Super cute garden in the back too.  One of the best spots in Hoboken for sure."

author: Jacob Ullom
text: 'Best experience in Hoboken. Great food
column5: great people and great vibes. Shout out to the guys that make this place run because it‚Äôs straight fire! Keep up the good food!'

author: Glenn Coogan
text: 'Italian Dishes from the Apulia region
column5: appetizers
column6: salads
column7: pastas
column8: and personal pizzas notom your everyday Italian restaurant.'

author: Luis Mordan
text: 'Relatively new to Hoboken and a welcomed addition!! Although the sign on the storefront refers to a "pizza" place
column5: and that\'s where they have the most options on the menu
column6: it is so much more. The Italian style gourmet pizza that we had was delicious. It did remind me of the pizza in Italy. Great seafood- prawns
column7: swordfish
column8: salmon and sushi grade tuna antipasti was amazing! The pasta dishes were served "aldente" which is personally how I love pasta. The staff was friendly and attentive. Good espresso is a must and I wasn\'t disappointed. Great for groups of all kinds and all ages. Indoor and outdoor seating in the front and rear options for sun or shade. Don\'t forget to BYOB.'

author: Jo A
text: 'Great find.  Relaxed atmosphere and BYOB. Very authentic cuisine and service was very friendly and attentive.  Great options
column5: we all had something different and every thing was great!'

author: Leo Cicchetti
text: 'Best pizza!!'

author: David Wilson
text: 'Hoboken has a serious pizza problem. That is
column5: it has really bad pizza ‚Äî and a lot of it. There‚Äôs a frat-boy pizza place on every corner; all with the same thick doughy insipid pizza.\n\nSo when I saw yet another pizza restaurant opening I was less than thrilled. Until I went there today. It is by far the best pizza I‚Äôve ever had in Hoboken and the best I‚Äôve had in years. Impeccable crust seared beautifully with prosciutto
column6: aged Reggiano and baby arugula. Absolutely first rate.\n\nüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜ'

author: Anthony DiIorgi
text: '(Translated by Google) In this restaurant
column5:
capocuocco Franco brings the Vera kitchen of Puglia. The food is delicious.

(Original)
In questa ristorante
column6: capocuocco franco porta la Vera cucina di Puglia. Il cibo √® buonissima.'

author: Nanina's in the Park
text: 'Great food and service'

author: Kathleen Heaney
text: 'Pizza Was Good
column5: Gnocchi Was Terrible - Majorly Overpriced. My husband and I ordered two pizzas and a pasta. Portions were very small. Pizza was tasty
column6: but the pesto gnocchi was tasteless. PLUS
column7: after delivery and tip... the bill came to $80! WHAT?! Dozzino is the same style pizza - tastier and cheaper. Will never order here again.'

author: Alan Babbitt
text: 'Octopus appetizer was tasty and well-prepared. Pizza was quite good
column5: maybe not the best I‚Äôve ever had but well above average for the area. Good service and friendly staff. BYOB is a big plus. Definitely will go back.'

author: Lorelle Cicitta
text: 'Great energy and ambiance. Pizza is to die for. However their pasta dishes are out of this world. Awesome service
column5: clean environment. So homey and just an all around excellent place to go to.'

author: Sayali Godbole
text: "Food wasn't as good. Quantity was too less."

author: Michael Desousa
text: 'Good service
column5: weird layout and bland food at best. I had the cavatelli and immediately thought "Wow this could use either some salt or cheese"and "This tastes like I made it!" I looked around and I noticed none of the tables had salt and pepper on them
column6: I felt weird about asking for salt at an Italian restaurant so I just kept eating this pasta. I would have asked for some cheese but not one person asked me how my meal was.  The octopus and salad were pretty good but the pasta I almost couldn\'t finish.  Ill just stick to the places in Hoboken that have been around a while.'

author: Thomas Schonig
text: "Layout of the place is kind of strange. Food was bland
column5: and the server made a few mistakes on our order. Menu doesn't have anything better or different than the other Italian spots in the neighborhood"

author: Meghan Fishman
text: 'Amazing food and amazing service. Love this local Hoboken spot!'

author: Elizabeth De Virgilio
text: 'The staff are all spectacular! The food is authentic
column5: made with love and delicious ingredients. They are very family friendly and there is plenty of space. Always a fantastic meal!'

author: Carmela Angelo Pasquale
text: 'Delicious Cibo and Excellent service. üëç'

author: Brian Quinn
text: 'Great pizza'

author: Jo Hayes
text: 'Great service. Pizza is very good but not life changing. Good BYOB spot.'

author: Richard Hajjar
text: 'After sampling pizza in Hoboken last 5+ years- this place is the real deal. Great service and even better food. Ambiance and energy are unique. Love byob status - cork is right across the street.This is now a go to place any day- err day.'

author: Carter Corriston
text: 'Truly authentic pizza made with all fresh ingredients  with a great atmosphere.  The desserts are all home made.  Avoid the crowds and bring a nice bottle of wine during the week'

author: Courtney O'Connor
text: "These guys really get it. Eating at Apulia is like being with family. Frank
column5: the owner
column6: wants to build his business organically which is so refreshing. If you have lived Hoboken for 15+ years you will really appreciate all of the vibes at Apulia. It's old school mentality for the next generation of restaurant entrepreneurs. Now onto the food - pizza is real deal with amazing sauce and cooked to perfection. Cavatelli is handmade on premises and delicious. To start we had the arugula salad and the octopus which were both amazing. Everything is made with love between Frank and his chef. These guys care about every detail of their restaurant. Get to Apulia and welcome them to the neighborhood. Love this place !!!"

author: Gilda Piccinelli
text: 'Byob place. Pizza was incredibly good. Very accurate service.'

author: Robert Lurie
text: "Overall
column5: place had a good atmosphere and is really nice
column6: definetly a great addition to uptown Hoboken. Not much to describe as far as atmosphere
column7: they clearly do focus on food
column8: as evidence by the massive brick pizza oven and equally huge manual fly wheel slicer for fresh Prosciutto de Parma. It's also byob which is a huge plus. The place is not huge
column9: and as such waits can be long at times
column10: luckily there a couple bars near by to grab a drink.\n\nMenu is limited
column12: and usually have a few good specials. Last time
column15: but I felt needed a little more garlic. We also ordered 2 pizzas
column16: the inferno and the caprina. Both are delicious Neapolitan\xa0style pizza.  After being there a few times
column17: all of the pizzas are delicious. Dessert is also very good
column18: with my wife's favorite being the Nutella calzone.\n\nOverall food is delicious
column19: service and organization have been improving
column20: as there were a couple stumbles in the beginning. My wife and I will delivery be back especially when the patio is open in summer."

author: Tigh Loughhead
text: 'Awesome food; truly phenomenal Italian fare.  The restaurant is welcoming
column5: the staff friendly and helpful and the Pizza is fantastic.'

author: Damian De Virgilio
text: 'I know what many of you are thinking
column5: "Hoboken needs another pizza place like it needs more parking restrictions." However
column6: the authenticity and quality at Apulia elevates it beyond the pack. The staff is very engaging and friendly (special thanks to Gaspare)
column7: which adds to the welcoming
column8: warm atmosphere. I may be bias because the cuisine leans towards the region of Italy of my roots
column9: but this only adds to its uniqueness among the standard fare. I removed a star only because I like my pizza crust a bit thinner and crispier

author: Gregg Binder
text: 'Good atmosphere and Italian style pizza is a nice change of pace option'

author: Daniel deCavaignac
text: 'Dining room and service were quite good.   Nothing super special but nothing bad either.   I just don‚Äôt like the value on the pizza.   It‚Äôs good pizza with thin crust and good quality ingredients but the pizzas are 4 slice personal pies for $18+ Each..   3 of us ate 1 pizza each for lunch and after tip and tax it was $68.  Wow.   Hoboken has a ton of pizza places and I am just not sure this price point remains viable.'

author: Karen Siegel
text: 'Yummy pizza and salads
column5: and excellent service.'

author: Chloe Reyes
text: 'This was so godly
column5: 100 percent recommend'

author: Elan Kagan
text: 'Amazing food'

author: Aria Music
text: 'AMAZING PIZZA'

author: Joseph hamill
text: 'Nutella calzone is fire'

author: Ben Guyamier
text: "Great pizza with phenomenal service.\nWe dropped in on a Saturday at 6:30 with an infant AND a toddler expecting to be told we needed a reservation. Not only did they seat us right away
column5: but they put us at a great table in the back.\nSince it's BYOB
column6: the waiter pointed me to a local wine store 1 block away.\nThe white pizza was AWESOME! And highly recommend the pistachio desert.\nMusic was also great. when we asked the name of a song that played
column7: the owner came over to talk to us about the music and how he ended up picking the location.\nOverall a great
